name: form_name
label: Form Name

name: form_version
label: Version

name: materials_list
label: Materials Needed: 1) Decomp Bags pre-weighed with barcodes - see the Kobo Form "psa_decomp_bag_pre_wt" for more information first. 2) XL plastic bags for biomass harvest 3) hand shears or cutting tools 4) meter sticks 5) field scale to at least 1 decimal point 6) large plastic tub 7) small plastic tub 8) gloves 9) PPE 10) glyphosate and per-emergents in a spray backpack 11) landscape staples and flags

name: first_time
label: Welcome to Precision Sustainable Agriculture Data Collection form for Cover Crop Biomass Harvest and Decomposition Bags
hint: Is this your first time collecting biomass on-farm?

name: code
label: What is the 3 letter site Code?
hint: These 3 letter codes were selected for you when you enrolled a farm

name: gps_code
label: Select a single GPS point to represent this 3 letter site code
hint: (if you have not already done this in site enrollement. This will be the point used for mapping locations and pulling weather data)

name: termination_date
label: Don't forget to record the termination date of this cover crop
hint: In the new Google Site Enrollment Sheet

name: field_diagram
label: Walk around your field, examining the perimenter of your cover crop and bare treatment areas. Visually select Subplots 1 and 2 where you will harvest biomass

name: biomass_diagram
label: Inside each subplot cover crop you will take 2 biomass samples - represented here in the diagram as A and B. Each will be 1 meter square area. We want to help you accurately measure 1 meter square harvest areas, which can be variable per user, based on planting equipment and tools. Use the next guide.

name: drilled_broad
label: Was the cover crop planted with a drill or broadcast?

name: drill_spacing
label: If drilled, what is the drill line spacing in inches?

name: drill_spacing_note
label: That is ${drill_spacing_cm} in centimeters right?

name: harvest_length
guidance_hint: This is how long you will harvest 6 drill lines

name: harvest_length_note
label: To equal 1 meter square area in THIS field: You will harvest 6 drill lines, for this many centimeters each:  ${harvest_length}
hint: Select 6 representative drill lines in your subplot.

name: Next_take_2_extra_l_g_tools_to_Subplot_1
label: Next take  2 extra large plastic bags, measuring device, and cutting tools, and this tablet to take GPS, to Subplot 1

name: broadcast_note
label: Your field is Broadcast:  You will harvest TWO (A and B) one meter square areas (100 cm x 100 cm) by using meter sticks, or a pre-made 1 meter quadrat.
hint: If you choose to do a half meter quadrat, make sure to do it twice for A and twice for B.

name: tools_note_sub1
label: Next take 2 extra large plastic bags, a meter square measuring device, and cutting tools, and this tablet to take GPS, to Subplot 1
hint: You will harvest 2 sub-samples (we will call them A and B) inside each subplot.

name: sub1_legume
label: Is the cover crop in Subplot 1 made up of more or less than 40% legume?

name: fresh_wt_a1
label: What is the Fresh Wt of Subsample A (fresh biomass/ m2 including the bag) in grams?

name: fresh_wt_b1
label: What is the Fresh Wt of Subsample B (fresh biomass/ m2 including the bag) in grams?

name: note_pour_sub1
label: Next pour the contents of both Subsample A and B into one large container or tote. There are 2 meters inside.  Mix them all together.  Walk back into the field, and clip extra handfuls of cover crop and throw them into the tote too.

name: bag_a1
label: What is the weight of empty bag A (in grams)?

name: bag_b1
label: What is the weight of empty bag B (in grams)?

name: This_is_the_average_h_wt_grams_correct
label: This is the average fresh weight of your Subplot 1, ${sub1_average_fresh_wt} grams, correct?

name: target
label: Next we divide that weight by 6, to get the target fresh weight for each of the 12 decomp bags in that subplot.  Your target fresh weight (in grams) to stuff inside the decomp bag in this subplot is:: ${target1_bag_wt}

name: Target_weight_target1_bag_wt
label: Target weight:  ${target1_bag_wt}

name: Fill_12_bags_10_mes_s_and_B_s_T0_to_T5
label: Now fill 12 bags (10 mesh and 2 paper) for subplot 1 (A’s and B’s) T0 to T5. Fill them in random order for your whole subplot.

name: group_000
label: Decomp Bag Fresh Subplot1  inside target weight:  ${target1_bag_wt}

name: barcode_bag_000
label: Use the camera to scan a barcode

name: fresh_bag_wt_grams_000
label: Total Fresh Wt (grams)
hint: This total weight is the target weight PLUS bag and tag

name: Barcode_didn_t_scan
label: Barcode didn't scan?

name: group_001
label: Decomp Bag Fresh Subplot1  inside target weight:  ${target1_bag_wt}

name: barcode_bag_001
label: Use the camera to scan a barcode

name: fresh_bag_wt_grams_001
label: Total Fresh Wt (grams)
hint: This total weight is the target weight PLUS bag and tag

hint: This total weight is the target weight PLUS bag and tag

name: end_sub1
label: You have finished with Subplot 1. Continue the same process for Subplot 2.  Place 2 paperbags from Subplot 1 in the truck and we will return to the mesh bags later.

name: sub2
label: Begin Subplot 2

name: tools_note_sub2
label: Take 2 extra large plastic bags, a meter square measuring device, and cutting tools to Subplot 2
hint: You will harvest 2 sub-samples (we will call them A and B) inside each subplot.

name: sub2_legume
label: Is the cover crop stand in Subplot 2 made up of more or less than 40% legume?

name: fresh_wt_a2

name: fresh_wt_b2

name: target2

name: Target_weight_target2_bag_wt
label: Target weight:  ${target2_bag_wt}

name: end_sub2
label: You have finished with Subplot 2. You will bring 4 paper bags back to the lab to dry at 60C. The 20 remaining mesh decomp bags should be placed in the field, if planted with cash crop, or at the field edge until crop rows are in place.

name: more_instructions
label: Now you can proceed to the PSA GPS form on Kobo, or you can wait to GPS when you place decomp bags and install sensors. It's harder to do GPS as the crop gets larger.
